body.p: A Kentucky attorney and politician. Educated in public schools. Married to Ann R. Lockridge Anderson. Father of Harry C. Anderson, Nancy A. Anderson, Herbert L. Anderson, Robert L. Anderson, Mayes Anderson, and Lillian Anderson. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860. Lived in Mayfield, Kentucky. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1845. Presidential elector for the Whig Party in 1852. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1855 to 1857. Served the First Congressional District of Kentucky as an Unconditional Unionist member of the United States House of Representative from the 1863 to 1865. Delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1864.
